column5: Totally agree haha. Probably going to get the Frabill Big Kahuna.  For your boat I'd recommend the Frabill Big Game, a bit smaller and not as deep than the Kahuna, better for lower boats! The Kahuna would also be a beast to wield solo...Thats where the Beckman was nice, it was the lightest Muskie net on the market...Sadly no longer available...
Makes sense. Thanks for the info!
If anyone wants to learn more about jigging for muskies check out this months edition of Musky Hunter Magazine, which features an article from John Bondy, the maker of the baits I use in this video.
I filmed some of the Muskie jigging I did over this past summer, check it out & tight lines!
Great video thanks for sharing it
Very nice,that would be a blast with that sudden hit !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Nice , great video, I'd consider a shorter rod for jigging, especially if you are fishing alone, netting the first 2 looked awkward.
Cool vid!  always wondered if that worked in the summer
Nice job man!

Jiggin' skies is something I usually have to wait ti'll November for... Living on the Detroit and doing it all year round would be a blast.  Nice little vid dood!  Get's me itching to maybe road trip that way next month.
Thanks guys
Great video, I enjoyed it!
Now THAT was super cool!
Great watch!!!
You have detroit river jigging, we have simcoe jigging, but no Musky.LOL  That would be a blast. Very cool.
Give Simcoe a couple more years Brian! Great video. The river is never calm like that when I am there. That actually looked quite pleasant.
Nice vid! I have had a couple of skis jigging small bulldawgs along deep weedlines. I wondered if anyone else was doing it in warm water.
I know I keep saying it but man I gotta try jigging here on the st lawrence...
You guys have some giants up there, it would be epic to get one of them jigging haha
Thats a sweet video man!
Awesome.  I can see how that would be addicting...
Very nice! I actually purchased a 6' handle for my Beckman for when I fished alone- only way to reach the fish with long rods (RIP Beckman ...)
Might have to do something like that. As you can see in the video my musky net is a POS, I need to get a new one anyway.
Great job on the video and great fish too!!

Might have to do something like that. As you can see in the video my musky net is a POS, I need to get a new one anyway.  Yup, if you can afford the rod, reel, Iphone and fancy Go Pro...No excuse for for not having a quality net.  Cool video though.
Totally agree haha. Probably going to get the Frabill Big Kahuna.
Nice video, never knew you could jig for them in deep rivers or chanels
great video!  Thanks for sharing it
